instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Hi I received a board and it had 1/4 fan spin
Replaced c7721 it was Still shorted then replaced  u7720 and got the board working
Chime, booting, activity on screen but no backlight. After using dosdude gmux I still had no backlight replaced lp8550 and fuse
:( now the board is dead again I removed lp8550 and I have the
Same short on L7720 and u7720
I didn’t apply a lot of heat and was in and out quickly. What would give me the same short again? I’ve tested around u7880 and it’s not shorted also GPU isn’t in direct short. P.S. Board was running for most of the day and at J5650 pin 1 PP5v_S0 (fan connector) I have 5v but no fan spin :/ I also replace Q5502, Q5501 because they were missing

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
"activity on screen but no backlight. After using dosdude gmux"
Why did you touch GMUX, if had image???

What is the actual state of the board?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Well 
PPBUS_G3H  is 12.53v 
PP3v3_S3 =3.3v
PP5v_s3=5v
PP3v3_S0=3.3v
PP5v_S0=5v 
PPDDR_S3_REG_R


PCH is Warm CPU is warm

I just flash Gmux in everyone of these Even if its working. just in case.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Do you get L7220 voltage now?
Board stays on?
Exact VCORE voltage after 10s?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
L7220 =5v
PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1/PH2/PH3= 0v
PPVCORE_S0_AXG_L=0v

I had a issue on L7720 and that’s still .0v in diode mode to ground

what can kill this IC for a second time ?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
My mistake, I wanted to ask about L7720, not L7220.

Can you post exact ohm value on L7720?
Lift it one side and see where the short remains.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
With removed L7720 and u7720
Pin 2 =260 ohms
Pin 1 =OL

I also removed Y5010
And put it aside

before removal of u7720 it was 0.v to ground On pin 1 with L7720 removed. 
after removing U7720 pin 1 shows OL

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
260 ohm is far away of a short.
I didn't say to remove U7720; resolder it and check again ohm value at L7720 pin 1.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
With u7720, L7720  soldered t’s 22ohms
[COLOR=rgb(44, 130, 201)]260ohms is with both unsolder [/COLOR]

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Then replace U7720 and post its new voltages.
Be sure both R7720/21 are good.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: Ok. I recheck R7720/21 one question can I power on this board wIthout u7720 and L7720? I wanna make sure there’s no spikes on 3v3_s5 that might kill it again

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Yes, you can.
But U7720 should be the last you afraid of 3V3_S5 spikes.
SMC and PCH are directly connected there, and much more sensitive...

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: Ok fan spinning ,Chime. Steady 1.8v now on to backlight issue. One question is there a downlink for MRI (resource inspector)

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
So board works now, but no backlight?
Do you have image?

Try using Google for MRI...

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Yes I have image no backlight. I have all the enable signals. The resistors on the voltage divider are good and capacitor isn’t shorted. The voyage is 11.53v at gate of mosfet. I believe the mosfet isn’t sending it to ground. But I dont have the part# on my phone it’s on the notepad at home. I’ll get you all the specifics Part# when I get back home. 
I did google mri but I’m confused as to which one is the right link. I found these which is one you’d consider downloading? Or if you have the site and you can point me in the righT direction That would be greatly appreciated

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: Post BKL_EN/PWM, LCD_BKLT_EN and BKLT_PLT_RST_L levels; with LCD connected.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
BLK_EN =3.1v
Blk_PLT_RST_L=3.3v
LCD_BKLT_EN=3.3v
LCDBKLT_EN_DIV=4V
BKL_PWM=2.5v resistor is 33ohm
I’m thinking Q9706 is bad :/

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
"LCDBKLT_EN_DIV=4V"
You should have (at least) PPBUS_G3H voltage at L9701.
If not, Q9706 is bad.
Be sure no short to grround at D9701 pins; with LCD connected, of course.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: Ok so I test for voltage at c9797 and got 0v D9701 tested good Q9706 Was internally shorted replaced Q9706 and have 40v at C9797&C9799 but not at C9000 or pins 38,39,40 on lvds connector tried running 30awg from C9797&C9799 to pond 38,39,40 and got  no backlight. Resistance to ground on these pins reads “OL” Is this gauge Of wire to small? I see there’s some sort of filter but it looks like it’s internal :/

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Rebuild the trace correctly.
Check connector and video cable for damage.

40V seems to be correct voltage for this 15" model.
Usually voltage goes higher than 50V if LEDs strip don't make contact.

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: Ok so Once I put wire connected directly to lvds backlight is on. just extremely dim BKL_PWM=2.5v I would think With that voltage it would have some brightness. But I also might be up against no image on this one :/ As I don’t have a flashing folder. Usb mouse connected and have activity and a chime

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
Image should appear before backlight.
If internal video output is not enabled, no reason to search for backlight.
Do you get voltage at pins 2/3 & 4 of J9000?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
J9000
Pins
2&3 =3.3v
4 = 3.3v
L9010,L9011 have continuity
L9000 has continuity

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
So you have backlight now?
Black, or pure white screen?
Did you try to boot USB macOS?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: I wanna say it’s on but leds are very dim it’s not noticeable with lights on. Black not white but barely visible. I made a video but I can’t upload it. I will pop it in a case now see what happens

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: No it won’t boot I have a stage light affect on both screens kind of like when a tv hoes to sleep. I was wondering if maybe this issue is like a lid closed Affect or SMC_LID_R. Issue? Where the screen thinks it’s closed?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
"J9000
Pins
2&3 =3.3v"
Means LCD_PWR_EN is present; only possible if SMC_LID signal is correct.

The exact voltage at pins 38-40 of J9000?
Measure with LCD connected, of course.
L9010/11, both good?

Did you check external video?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
well I checked L9010/11 for continuity and they have continuity so I assume they’re good. 
I wont get external video from this unit as dosdudes gmux disables this feature. 
I will measure the 38-40 again. Thank you for your help :)

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message: Also I saw you posted a bios For 820-2915 with gpu disabled. Will that survive a nvram ?

threads.title: 820-2915 1/4 fan spin
threads.message:
BIOS mod does NOT survive PRAM reset.
EFI password must be set, to prevent that.
